body_html:
Sorry if I wasn't clear, it actually needs a version greater than 0.3.2 (0.3.2 doesn't include the sandbox_tmpfs_path flag).

Without this flag the execution of the test fails as Chrome tries to write /dev/shm (which is symlinked to /run/shm), and it is read-only in the default sandbox. This flag causes the Bazel sandbox to mount a tmpfs filesystem at /run/shm that Chrome can then write to.

Without this flag the execution of the test fails as Chrome tries to write /dev/shm (which is symlinked to /run/shm), and it is read-only in the default sandbox. This flag causes the Bazel sandbox to mount a tmpfs filesystem at /run/shm that Chrome can then write to.
body:
Sorry if I wasn't clear, it actually needs a version greater than 0.3.2 (0.3.2 doesn't include the sandbox_tmpfs_path flag).

Without this flag the execution of the test fails as Chrome tries to write /dev/shm (which is symlinked to /run/shm), and it is read-only in the default sandbox. This flag causes the Bazel sandbox to mount a tmpfs filesystem at /run/shm that Chrome can then write to.
